summary: A video where Astrobloke, a passionate astronomer, shares his journey of automating his observatory roof using a gate opening motor. The video showcases different aspects of the project, including his motives, the products used, and future plans for fully integrated operation.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen, followed by a scene where a man is seen in a dimly lit room with a telescope labeled 'ALTAIR' in the background. He is wearing a dark hoodie and appears to be explaining something, gesturing with his hands. The room has a metallic, reflective surface, and there are various cables and equipment visible. The scene transitions to a brighter setting where the man continues to speak, holding a small object in his hand. The background shows a window with a view of the outside, and the telescope remains in the frame. The man then points towards the telescope, emphasizing its features. The video then shifts to a computer screen displaying astronomical images, including a nebula and a star field, with the text 'Sky & Telescope' visible. The next scene shows a black screen with the word 'EQUIPMENT' in orange text, followed by a close-up of a telescope setup on a balcony, featuring various lenses and equipment. The video concludes with a view of the telescope setup, highlighting the intricate details of the equipment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with the sound of a manual roller door being opened. We hear a male speaker, in a friendly and enthusiastic tone, introducing himself as "Astro bloke" and mentioning he has a new toy - a button. This is followed by the distinct sound of a roller door being opened, presumably triggered by the button he mentioned. The speaker expresses his excitement, stating that he loves the button and could press it all day, before promising to show how he automated his roof and its cost. A brief snippet of electronic music then plays, featuring a hip-hop rhythm, a dark mood, and some electronic percussion. Lastly, the clip concludes with the sounds of the roller door being activated again.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a black NASA hoodie, seated in front of a computer setup in a room adorned with colorful artwork. He appears to be speaking, with a microphone clipped to his hoodie. The computer screen displays a webpage with a product listing for a "Steam2000 Electric Gate Opener 600kg 4 in 1," priced at £135.99, with a note indicating the item was last purchased on May 1, 2021. The product description highlights its features, including remote control capabilities and a capacity to handle up to 600kg. The webpage also shows options to add the item to the cart, with a note that only 2 units are in stock. The video then transitions to a close-up of the product listing, emphasizing the details of the electric gate opener kit, including its components and specifications. The background remains consistent, with the webpage's layout and design clearly visible, and the "Frequently bought together" section at the bottom of the page. The video maintains a focus on the product listing, providing a detailed view of the electric gate opener kit and its features.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with one male speaker describing a product they bought online for an installation. He mentions buying a gate-opening motor from Amazon, how there were many types varying in price, and why he chose the one he did. He mentions that some kits come with just the motor while others include everything. The speaker mentions the wattage of the motors and that his roof is extremely light so he did not need something that powerful. The speaker then announces that he is now going to show how he installed it. This transitions into the sound of a lawnmower or similar outdoor machine in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a view of a building with a corrugated metal roof and a window with closed blinds. A black speaker is mounted on a wooden structure attached to the building. The camera then zooms in on the speaker, revealing a keyhole on its front. A man wearing a black hoodie with a NASA logo appears, standing in front of the building. He gestures towards the speaker and the surrounding area, seemingly explaining or demonstrating something related to the speaker or the building. The background includes trees and a cloudy sky, indicating an outdoor setting. The man continues to gesture and speak, occasionally pointing at the speaker and the building's features, such as the window and the wooden structure. The video maintains a focus on the man and the speaker, with the background remaining consistent throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker starts by acknowledging that the audio quality isn't great, hoping the sound comes out okay due to the wind. He then explains an automated roof installation, contrasting an external installation with interior ones he has seen from other YouTubers. He mentions he had to go with an external installation because of clearance issues and plastic walls, which could not support a motor unit. All this is happening with strong wind sounds in the background.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a black hoodie with a NASA logo is seen standing outside near a wooden structure with a black speaker mounted on top. He appears to be explaining or demonstrating something related to the speaker and the structure. The man gestures towards the speaker and the surrounding area, occasionally looking at the camera and then back at the speaker. The background shows a cloudy sky and some greenery, indicating an outdoor setting. The camera then zooms in on the speaker, showing a close-up of the saw blade attached to the structure, which the man points out. The video concludes with a wider shot of the speaker and the structure, with the man still standing nearby, continuing his explanation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker explaining why something won't work indoors due to space constraints, emphasizing that it's designed for outdoor use and weatherproof. He acknowledges it would be neater indoors but impractical due to potential head injuries, then proceeds to describe it as a simple and effective design, neither too fast nor too slow. Throughout the speech, the background is filled with noticeable wind noise, which occasionally subsides. He then emphasizes how brilliant it is, expressing his addiction to pushing buttons, followed by the speaker describing a component attached to the roof with angled aluminum, including a half-meter length part that trigger a sensor to stop the roof from overrunning. The same speaker then describes the rotating cog that moves everything along, followed by the sound of wind.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a black machine mounted on a wooden platform attached to the side of a beige shed. The machine features a serrated edge, suggesting it is a type of saw. The camera then pans to the right, revealing more of the shed and the surrounding environment, which includes a wooden fence and some greenery. A man wearing a black hoodie with a NASA logo on it appears, standing next to the shed. He is seen adjusting the machine, reaching up to the serrated edge and making adjustments. The man seems to be explaining or demonstrating something about the machine, as he gestures with his hands and looks up at the machine. The video concludes with the man continuing to gesture and talk, with the machine and shed still visible in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker discussing the weight capacity of a roof mechanism, noting it's "way over the top" for the current roof, adding that many makes exist and there should be one suitable for most roofs. The speaker then pivots to discussing how to manually move the roof, referencing "the key here" and showing how to push it by hand. They point out the benefit that if locked, "the roof is actually locked" and secure. Following this, the speaker indicates they are "just gonna" move the roof again and that it can be stopped "wherever you want," further mentioning they can sit "under a little bit of it" when using the computer. Throughout, there is a low, constant ambient sound, possibly indicating an outdoor or vehicle environment.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing a black NASA hoodie standing outside in front of a wooden structure with a black speaker mounted on top. The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his facial expressions and the presence of a microphone clipped to his hoodie. The background shows a cloudy sky and some greenery, suggesting an outdoor setting. The scene then transitions to a close-up of a tablet and a smartphone placed on a table. The tablet displays a dark interface with various controls and a timeline, while the smartphone shows a live feed from a camera mounted on a mechanical arm, capturing the outdoor environment. The camera feed on the smartphone changes slightly, indicating movement or adjustment of the camera. The video maintains a focus on the technological setup, highlighting the interaction between the devices and the live feed they are displaying.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with one male speaker lamenting the awful weather and a poor forecast, preventing astrophotography. He mentions completing a mod he’s wanted to do for a while. A mechanical sound like a motor opening something is heard twice, followed by the speaker describing an iPhone camera in an observatory, connected via TeamViewer to a computer. He mentions the remote control for the observatory, stating its distance, and demonstrates opening the roof remotely. He expresses the desire to control the roof with the computer for true remote operation. The speaker concludes by mentioning a camera to keep an eye on the telescope.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a tablet and a smartphone placed on a desk, both displaying video editing software. The tablet screen shows a timeline with various clips and audio tracks, while the smartphone screen displays a live feed of a robotic arm in an outdoor setting. The scene then transitions to a man wearing a dark blue NASA hoodie with a red shirt underneath, standing in a room with metallic walls and ceiling, likely a technical or industrial space. He is speaking and gesturing with his hands, indicating he is explaining or demonstrating something related to the equipment around him, which includes a microphone and a robotic arm. The man continues to speak, occasionally pointing to the equipment, suggesting he is providing detailed information or instructions about the setup. The video maintains a focus on the man and the technical environment, emphasizing the educational or instructional nature of the content.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing making sure something is fully parked and then shutting the roof. He comments on how he could spend all day pushing these buttons, speaking in a casual tone. This is followed by the sound of rain, and the same male speaker resumes talking, mentioning he jumped back inside an observatory and stating that the weather is awful. He expresses satisfaction with the automated roof, noting it wasn't difficult or expensive. He then discusses his desire to remotely open and close the roof via PC, hopefully using Nina software, and asks for assistance if anyone knows how to achieve this, expressing gratitude.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a NASA hoodie, standing inside a room with a metallic interior, likely a workshop or studio. He is speaking to the camera, with a microphone clipped to his hoodie, and a camera setup visible in the background. The man gestures with his hands as he talks, occasionally pointing to the camera or making other expressive movements. Text appears on the screen, reading 'EMAIL ME AT ASTROBLOKI' in red and green letters, followed by 'EMAIL ME' in red letters, indicating a call to action for viewers to contact him. The man continues to speak, holding a small object in his hand, possibly a remote or a device related to the camera setup. The video concludes with a black screen displaying the text 'Thank you for watching www.Astrobloke.co.uk' in red letters, expressing gratitude to the viewers and providing a website for further information.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker instructing listeners to give details in the comment section, followed by thanking viewers for watching the video and soliciting questions in the comment section, promising to respond quickly. He mentions automating a device with a PC and anticipating the result. He then concludes with a closing statement to "take care" and wishes for "clear skies." This spoken section has a casual and encouraging tone. Concurrent sounds include consistent wind sounds and the sound of a rolling tarp-like material. The clip ends with a short hip-hop instrumental.
